components.name: Query Processor
components.description: Tracks issues dealing with query processing.

fields.summary: Insert into table removes existing data

comments.body: Attached the patch-1: we didn't check if the dest file exists or not when do the renaming.
[~aihuaxu], the change looks fine. Could you add a test which insert into a table twice and list the result?

According to https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/branch-2.6.0/hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hdfs/protocol/ClientProtocol.java#L458 rename will return false if file already exists. Are you finding that to be incorrect? I would like to understand thats the case, otherwise proposed solution *always* makes 2 calls to NN, instead of current solution which does it only when needed.
I didn't check HDFS call. From local call, it will return true and overwrite existing file. Let me test on the hdfs.
I will add a test case for that.

I see. Thats the bug in Hadoop's {{LocalFileSystem}} implementation. To work around I put this in https://github.com/apache/hive/blob/master/shims/common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/fs/ProxyFileSystem.java#L179
I think best way to workaround this issue of Hadoop's {{LocalFileSystem}} not honoring contract of Hadoop's {{FileSystem}} api is to place in our own local FileSystem (like ProxyFileSystem) in Hive tree. Open to other ideas as well.
Yeah. That makes sense. I notice there exists ProxyFileSystem in Hive. I will take a look at that.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12802724 - PreCommit-HIVE-MASTER-Build
yeah.. we already have similar arrangement for {{NullScanFileSystem}} in ql/src/main/resources/META-INF/services/org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem
Also, you may want to create HDFS ticket for this bug in LocalFileSystem.
Created HDFS-10385 for the HDFS work.
Patch-2: created a ProxyLocalFileSystem to workaround the existing LocalFileSystem issue.

Do we need both of following
+org.apache.hadoop.fs.LocalFileSystem
+org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.ProxyLocalFileSystem

Also, can you unset fs.DefaultFS at the end of test so that config doesn't leak for subsequent tests.

ServiceLoader will load LocalFileSystem and other FileSystem providers in the context after loading from the configuration file, which causes the file scheme mapping to be overwritten. So I added this to let ProxyLocalFileSystem to take precedence. I didn't find another way to workaround that. 

I will unset that for the test.

[~ashutoshc] Seems we may not need to unset in the test. I checked existing tests like groupby1.q test which sets {set fs.default.name=file:///;}}  but doesn't unset. Are you thinking of unseting {{set fs.defaultFS=;}} at the end of the test?
I was thinking of {{rest fs.defaultFS;}} which should restore it to its default config value.
Thanks. Didn't know there is a reset.
patch-3: address comments.
